1.verse: Chapter 1 -This is an oracle relating the word of the Lord to Israel through Malachi.

2.verse: The Lord’s Love for Israel -I have loved you, says the Lord,but you ask, “How have you shown your love?”

3.verse: Was not Esau Jacob’s brother? asks the Lord.Even so, I loved Jacob but I hated Esau.I reduced his hill country into a wastelandand made his heritage into a desert for jackals.

4.verse: When Edom says, “We have been crushed,but we will rebuild the ruins,”thus says the Lord of hosts:They may build, but I will demolish.They will be called a country of wickedness,the people with whom the Lord is angry forever.

5.verse: Your own eyes will see this, and you will say,“Great is the Lord,even beyond the borders of Israel.”

6.verse: The Blemished Offerings and Other Faults of Priests -A son honors his father,and a servant fears his master.If then I am a father,where is the honor due to me?So says the Lord of hoststo you priests who despise my name.You ask, “How have we despised your name?”

7.verse: By offering polluted food on my altar.Then you ask, “How have we polluted it?”By thinking that the table of the Lord may be despised.

8.verse: When you offer blind animals in sacrifice,is this not evil?And when you offer in sacrificethose who are lame or sick,is this not evil?If you offer such sacrifices to your governor,will he be pleased with them,or show you special favor,asks the Lord of hosts.

9.verse: In the same way,if you implore God to show mercy toward youwhen you have presented such offerings,do you think he will grant your request?Thus says the Lord of hosts.

10.verse: Oh, if only one of you would close the temple gatesand thus bring to an endthe pointless lighting of fires on my altar!I derive no pleasure from you,says the Lord of hosts,and I will not acceptany sacrifice from your hands.

11.verse: For from the rising of the sun to its settingmy name is great among the nations.Everywhere incense and a pure sacrificeare offered to my name.For my name is great among the nations,says the Lord of hosts.

12.verse: However, you profane my namewhen you claim that the table of the Lord is polluted,and that therefore the food offered on itis not worthy of respect.

13.verse: You also assert, “How tiresome all this is!”and you sniff scornfully at me,says the Lord of hosts.You bring an animalthat is stolen, lame, or diseased,and you present it to me as a sacrifice.Shall I accept this from your hands,asks the Lord.

14.verse: Accursed is the deceiverwho has a male in his flockand vows to give it,but then sacrifices a blemished animal to me.For I am a great king,says the Lord of hosts,and my name is held in awe among the nations.

1.verse: You Have Made Many People Stumble -Chapter 2 -And now, O priests,this commandment is for you.

2.verse: If you refuse to listen to meand do not sincerely resolveto give glory to my name,says the Lord of hosts,I will send a curse on you,and I will turn your blessings into a curse.Indeed, I have already done sobecause you have not heeded my warning.

3.verse: I will deprive you of the shoulderand spread dung on your faces,the dung of your offerings,and I will banish you from my presence.

4.verse: Then you will knowthat I sent you this commandmentbecause I wish to maintainmy covenant with Levi,says the Lord of hosts.

5.verse: My covenant with himwas one of life and peace,which I bestowed on him.He revered meand held my name in awe.

6.verse: The instruction he offered was true,and no dishonesty issued from his mouth.He walked with me in integrity and uprightness,and he turned many away from a sinful life.

7.verse: The lips of a priest should safeguard knowledge,and people should seek instruction from his mouthbecause he is the messenger of the Lord of hosts.

8.verse: But you have turned aside from the wayand caused many to stumbleas the result of your instruction.You have destroyed the covenant of Levi,says the Lord of hosts.

9.verse: Therefore, I have made you despised and vilein the eyes of all the people,inasmuch as you have disregarded my waysand have not been impartialin your interpretation of the law.

10.verse: Profaned Marriage -Do we all not have the one Father?Has not one God created us?Why then do we break faith with one another,profaning the covenant of our ancestors?

11.verse: Judah has broken faith,and an abominable thing has been donein Israel and in Jerusalem.By marrying the daughter of a foreign god,Judah has profaned the Lord’s beloved sanctuary.

12.verse: May the Lord banish from the tents of Jacobany who do this,and also deprive them of any witness or advocateor someone to present offerings to the Lord of hosts.

13.verse: You Betray the Woman of Your Youth -And this you are to do as well:you must cover the altar of the Lordwith tears, with weeping and moaning,because at present he refuses to consider your offeringor to accept it with satisfaction from your hand.

14.verse: If you ask the reason why,it is because the Lord stands as witnessbetween you and the wife of your youthwith whom you have broken faith,even though she is your partnerand your wife by a solemn covenant.

15.verse: Did not the one God make her,both flesh and spirit?And what does the one God requirebut God-given offspring?Therefore, you must safeguard your own life,and let none of you be unfaithfulto the wife of your youth.

16.verse: For I hate divorce,says the Lord, the God of Israel,as well as covering one’s garment with injustice,says the Lord of hosts.Therefore, have respect for your own life,and do not be unfaithful.

17.verse: God Will Come and Do Justice -You have wearied the Lord with your words.Yet you ask, “How have we wearied him?”By asserting, “All who do evilare good in the eyes of the Lord;indeed, he delights in them.”Or by asking,“Where is the God of justice?”

1.verse: Chapter 3 -Behold, I am sending my messengerto prepare the way before me.And suddenly the Lord whom you seekwill come to the temple,as well as the messenger of the covenantin whom you delight.Indeed he is coming,says the Lord of hosts.

2.verse: But who will be able to endurethe day of his coming,and who can stand when he appears?For he is like a refiner’s fireor like a fuller’s soap.

3.verse: He will sit refining and purifying;he will purify the descendants of Leviand refine them like gold or silverso that they may in righteousnessoffer due sacrifice to the Lord.

4.verse: Thus the offerings of Judah and Jerusalemwill be pleasing to the Lordas in the days of old,as in the years long past.

5.verse: Then I will draw near to you for judgment,and I will be swift to bear witnessagainst the sorcerers, adulterers, and perjurers,against those who defraud the hired laborer of his wages,against those who wrong widows and orphans,against those who thrust aside the foreigner,and against those who do not fear me,says the Lord of hosts.

6.verse: Make the Tithe Offering to the Lord -For I, the Lord, do not change,and you have not ceased to be sons of Jacob.

7.verse: Since the days of your fathersyou have turned aside from my statutesand have not kept them.Return to me,and I will return to you,says the Lord of hosts.Yet you ask,“How can we return?”

8.verse: Can a man rob God?Yet you are robbing me.You ask, “How do we rob you?”In your tithes and offerings.

9.verse: There is a curse on you all,for your entire nation has defrauded me.

10.verse: Bring the tithes in full into the treasuryso that there may be food in my house.Put me thus to the test,says the Lord of hosts,and see if I will not openthe windows of heaven for youand pour down blessings upon youwithout measure.

11.verse: For your sake I will forbid the locuststo destroy the produce of your soil,and the vines in your fields will not be barren,says the Lord of hosts.

12.verse: Then all nations will call you blessed,for yours will be a land of delight,says the Lord of hosts.

13.verse: The Just Will Have Their Revenge -You have spoken harsh words against me,says the Lord.Yet you ask,“What have we said against you?”

14.verse: You have said,“It is useless to serve God.What do we profit by keeping his commandsor by going about in penitential garbbefore the Lord of hosts?

15.verse: For our part,we regard the arrogant as happy.Evildoers not only prosper,but when they put God to the test,they come to no harm.”

16.verse: Then those who feared the Lordspoke with one another.The Lord listened attentively,and a book of remembrance was written before himof those who feared himand trusted in his name.

17.verse: They shall be mine,says the Lord of hosts,my own special possessionon the day when I act,and I will have compassion on themas a father has compassionon the son who serves him.

18.verse: Then you will once again see the differencebetween the just and the wicked,between the one who serves Godand the one who refuses to serve him.
